body: I'm trying to run some Energyplus simulations, I get two error messages: 1. No .eio file was found adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.Results cannot be read back into grasshopper without this file. 2-2. No surface information was found in the imported .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.Data cannot be normalized by surface area and the data tree outputs for surface data will not be grafted by zone. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Qyn*Uz1WnG*oqX*yN37m7*rvFvzWi4TfxdsWEojntNr-3GCeIkV1YQJrjjn9gldsO8D0q4ZDkfA*n11tdnIh6P8ejnOhjtDX/Canvasat084140.png)
topic: What does it mean when I have this error message ?

replies.body: It's usually a result of failure of energy simulation in the first point. Are you sure the simulation is running fine?

Hi Mostapha,

I get the same error..I've seen all the discussion replies; I updated the file components as Rania did too; I wrote a new the algorithm so to avoid Rania problems(as suggested from Chris) but still I have the same error: "1. No surface information was found in the imported .eio file adjacent to the .csv _resultFileAddress.Data cannot be normalized by surface area and the data tree outputs for surface data will not be grafted by zone". It's a long time that I'm trying to figure out what's the problem..could you please have a look to the file?THANK YOU SO MUCH

Ernesto,

There were supposed to be problems with the file you attached?

Just a couple of issues that i fixed it works fine for me. See attached.

-A.

Abraham,



thank you very much, now it works!



Ern

After I updated my HB using the update Honeybee components the simulation fails, it used to run fine right before the update. I noticed some empty outputs coming out the HB flying component, is there something wrong with my installation? I really need to figure out what's happening with this as I have a deadline to finish this work for a research paper I'm working on.  Thanks in advance[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/njfi925B3DAvaAeiVWw0pvDxb8tFaLliEAb7JVf*jiibZFOULHNOfjXiUvIzlmuIgWXDcshJEWCbKyBjaAg3oP2uHQTA9I3*/Canvasat153527.png)
That shouldn't make any issues. Can you upload your file so we can take a look? I can check it later today. -Mostapha
Here are the files, I really appreciate it.
and here is the GH file
Also it might be helpful if you read readMe! output of runEnergySimulation component. You can find the error in your simulation there.
I'll take a look right now

Here is the error output, it says there is a missing input. However, the picture below shows that I've connected all required data, unless I'm missing something [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/njfi925B3DBSNKN*CJcy5uIB*jtjcc1xxe*EuQPFWYfPye1batccvvRuPlsNGfJQFySber2fLHs5aEfTj1-DzHZJXTBiL7Dq/Canvasat160257.png)
